metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20284 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-common - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-for-build - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-for-host - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-multiarch - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-source - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.38-2ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.38-2ubuntu1
libbinutils - 2.38-2ubuntu1
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.38-2ubuntu1
libctf0 - 2.38-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code isn't present in focal and earlier, need to investigate if reproducer works

criterions.comment: binutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.38-2ubuntu1').
